did.abstract: This collection consists of two ledgers which belonged to the business Wilmurt and Andrews, each containing lists of daily sales and expenditures dating from 1839-1915.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Immediate source of acquisition unknown. Officially accessioned in 1985.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The ledgers are arranged in two folders chronologically.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: Wilmurt and Andrews owned a general store and possibly owned rental houses in New York City in the 19th and early 20th centuries.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Wilmurt and Andrews ledgers, 1985.023, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024. At that time, the surname of one of the business's proprietors was corrected from Wilmot to Wilmurt based on what is written in the front of the first ledger.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two ledgers which belonged to the business Wilmurt and Andrews, each containing lists of daily sales and expenditures dating from 1839-1915. Sales include provisions for families and ships, such as meat, fish, sugar, bread, produce, dairy products, and other goods. Wilmurt and Andrews conducted business in New York City.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: These items are in the public domain.
